alert.note: Alert for Guilford; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 2:17PM EDT until July 21 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Guilford and Randolph. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 217 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greensboro, High Point, Randleman, McLeansville, Summerfield, Gibsonville, Pleasant Garden, Jamestown, Liberty, Staley, Forest Oaks, Climax, Monticello and Haw River State Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
